{"step_by_step_thinking": "The contractile element in a skeletal muscle refers to the part of the muscle responsible for generating force and contraction. Based on the provided documents, the contractile element is composed of actin and myosin filaments, which are repeated in units called sarcomeres. Sarcomeres are the basic functional, contractile units of the muscle fiber necessary for muscle contraction. Therefore, the contractile element is present in the myofibril, which is composed of sarcomeres.", "answer_choice": "C. Myofibril"}
